DataElement.preferredName: Prostatectomy or Radiation Primary Curative Treatment Within Ninety Days Post Enrollment Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes No indicator to signify whether patient is scheduled to undergo prostatectomy or initiate radiation for primary curative treatment of adenocarcinoma of the prostate within 90 days of enrollment

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostatectomy Radiation Therapy First-Line Therapy Cure Scheduled Within Ninety Day Post Enrollment Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the prostate._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition._Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy._To order a planned list of activities or events._On the inside; contained in._A natural number greater than eighty-nine and less than ninety-one and the quantity that it denotes._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prostatectomy Radiation Therapy First-Line Therapy Cure Scheduled
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the prostate.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the prostate.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.
Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.
To order a planned list of activities or events.

Property.preferredName: Within Ninety Day Post Enrollment Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:A natural number greater than eighty-nine and less than ninety-one and the quantity that it denotes.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than eighty-nine and less than ninety-one and the quantity that it denotes.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.
